name: Media Tracker
author: TheBitCraft

sections.description:
Effortlessly track and manage media file usage across your WordPress site with Media Tracker. Identify and remove unused images to optimize your site’s performance, and easily locate where each image is being used across posts, pages, and custom post types. Improve your site’s efficiency and keep your media library clutter-free. With Media Tracker, you have full control over your media assets, ensuring your site runs smoothly and efficiently.

Features

**ðŸ”¥ Media Usage: The Media Usage feature provides a comprehensive overview of where each image is used across your WordPress site, including posts, pages, and custom post types. Easily locate and manage your media files to ensure that all assets are being utilized effectively. This feature helps maintain a well-organized media library and prevents redundancy by identifying media usage across your content.

**ðŸ”¥ Cleaner: The Cleaner feature helps optimize your WordPress site by identifying and listing all unused images in your media library. With just a few clicks, users can review the list and remove unwanted or unused images, freeing up storage space and improving site performance. The Cleaner feature makes it simple to declutter your media library and ensures that only necessary images are retained, keeping your site lean and efficient.
sections.installation:
Minimum Requirements

  • PHP version 5.6.0 or greater (PHP 7.2 or greater is recommended)
  • MySQL version 5.0 or greater (MySQL 5.6 or greater is recommended)

Automatic installation

The automatic installation is the easiest way to install any plugin in WordPress. You can perform an automatic installation by logging in to your WordPress dashboard, navigating to the “Plugins” menu and clicking on the “Add New” button.

This will open up a page showing all the available plugins in WordPress. In the search field, type Media Tracker. The search result will show you our Media Tracker plugin. You can then see the detailed info by clicking on “More Details” and to install just click on the “Install Now” button.

Manual installation

Go to Dashboard > Plugins > Add New, then upload media-tracker.zip file and click Install Now.
sections.faq:
Q. Where can I get support?

A. You can get support by posting on the support section of this plugin on the WordPress plugin directory, or via email at: hello@thebitcraft.com

Q. Can I use my existing WordPress theme?

A. Sure, you can use your existing WordPress theme with Media Tracker.

Q. Where can I report a bug?

A. Found a bug? Please let us know by posting on the support section of this plugin on the WordPress plugin directory or directly via email at: hello@thebitcraft.com
sections.changelog:
1.0.1 [25/08/2024]

  • The query argument of wpdb prepare issue fixed
  • Deprecated passing null to parameter issue fixed

1.0.0 [12/07/2024]

  • Initial version released
